item.title: Scraping the Surface of Airtable (Part 2)
item.description: Photo by jimmy teoh from Pexels Before we start, let’s appreciate the fact that the first part is 2 yrs old! Anyway, after 2 years of working on another things, I came back around to the same problem today. Still the same idea as part one, that is how can i connect multiple bases without the need of logging into airtable. This part will be built on top of the first one, or to summarize: turns out I’m on the right track and requestId doesn’t really matter too much, maybe I made mistake in copying it in the last post?

item.title: Scraping the Surface of Airtable (Part 1)
item.description: Recently the company I’m working in started using and tinkering with this google sheets like relational database service (to be honest I think this description may be misleading, it will do you better to just checkout the product here. After tinkering around with it I’m wondering if I can just scrape data from airtable without the use of API and just the feature of view sharing. But, before I continue, Disclaimer :
